title-group.article-title: Managing Exchange Risks in a Floating World

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1976 Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System

abstract.p: Floating exchange rates have focused attention on the corporate problem of exchange risk management. The authors discuss methods of predicting exchange rates and ways accounting exposure can lead one to misconstrue decisions to be made. This paper deals with hedging, borrowing, and intracompany maneuvers, and recommends the use of chance-constrained programming to map out the degree of accounting risk that corporate managers choose to bear.
